00024 namespace GeographicLib {
00025 
00026   /**
00027    * \brief Ordnance Survey grid system for Great Britain
00028    *
00029    * The class implements the coordinate system used by the Ordnance Survey for
00030    * maps of Great Britain and conversions to the grid reference system.
00031    *
00032    * See
00033    * - <a href="http://www.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/oswebsite/gps/docs/A_Guide_to_Coordinate_Systems_in_Great_Britain.pdf">
00034    * A guide to coordinate systems in Great Britain</a>
00035    * - <a href="http://www.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/oswebsite/gps/information/coordinatesystemsinfo/guidetonationalgrid/page1.html">
00036    * Guide to National Grid</a>
00037    *
00038    * \b WARNING: the latitudes and longitudes for the Ordnance Survey grid
00039    * system do not use the WGS84 datum.  Do not use the values returned by this
00040    * class in the UTMUPS, MGRS, or Geoid classes without first converting the
00041    * datum (and vice versa).
00042    **********************************************************************/
00043   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT OSGB {
00044   private:
00045     typedef Math::real real;
00046     static const std::string letters_;
00047     static const std::string digits_;
00048     static const TransverseMercator OSGBTM_;
00049     static const real northoffset_;
00050     enum {
00051       base_ = 10,
00052       tile_ = 100000,
00053       tilelevel_ = 5,
00054       tilegrid_ = 5,
00055       tileoffx_ = 2 * tilegrid_,
00056       tileoffy_ = 1 * tilegrid_,
00057       minx_ = - tileoffx_ * tile_,
00058       miny_ = - tileoffy_ * tile_,
00059       maxx_ = (tilegrid_*tilegrid_ - tileoffx_) * tile_,
00060       maxy_ = (tilegrid_*tilegrid_ - tileoffy_) * tile_,
00061       // Maximum precision is um
00062       maxprec_ = 5 + 6,
00063     };
00064     static real computenorthoffset() throw();
00065     static void CheckCoords(real x, real y);
00066     static int lookup(const std::string& s, char c) throw() {
00067       std::string::size_type r = s.find(toupper(c));
00068       return r == std::string::npos ? -1 : int(r);
00069     }
00070     template<typename T> static std::string str(T x) {
00071       std::ostringstream s; s << x; return s.str();
00072     }
00073     OSGB();                     // Disable constructor
00074 
00075   public:
00076 
00077     /**
00078      * Forward projection, from geographic to OSGB coordinates.
00079      *
00080      * @param[in] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00081      * @param[in] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00082      * @param[out] x easting of point (meters).
00083      * @param[out] y northing of point (meters).
00084      * @param[out] gamma meridian convergence at point (degrees).
00085      * @param[out] k scale of projection at point.
00086      *
00087      * \e lat should be in the range [-90, 90]; \e lon and \e lon0 should be in
00088      * the range [-180, 360].
00089      **********************************************************************/
00090     static void Forward(real lat, real lon,
00091                         real& x, real& y, real& gamma, real& k) throw() {
00092       OSGBTM_.Forward(OriginLongitude(), lat, lon, x, y, gamma, k);
00093       x += FalseEasting();
00094       y += northoffset_;
00095     }
00096 
00097     /**
00098      * Reverse projection, from OSGB coordinates to geographic.
00099      *
00100      * @param[in] x easting of point (meters).
00101      * @param[in] y northing of point (meters).
00102      * @param[out] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00103      * @param[out] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00104      * @param[out] gamma meridian convergence at point (degrees).
00105      * @param[out] k scale of projection at point.
00106      *
00107      * The value of \e lon returned is in the range [-180, 180).
00108      **********************************************************************/
00109 
00110     static void Reverse(real x, real y,
00111                         real& lat, real& lon, real& gamma, real& k) throw() {
00112       x -= FalseEasting();
00113       y -= northoffset_;
00114       OSGBTM_.Reverse(OriginLongitude(), x, y, lat, lon, gamma, k);
00115     }
00116 
00117     /**
00118      * OSGB::Forward without returning the convergence and scale.
00119      **********************************************************************/
00120     static void Forward(real lat, real lon, real& x, real& y) throw() {
00121       real gamma, k;
00122       Forward(lat, lon, x, y, gamma, k);
00123     }
00124 
00125     /**
00126      * OSGB::Reverse without returning the convergence and scale.
00127      **********************************************************************/
00128     static void Reverse(real x, real y, real& lat, real& lon) throw() {
00129       real gamma, k;
00130       Reverse(x, y, lat, lon, gamma, k);
00131     }
00132 
00133     /**
00134      * Convert OSGB coordinates to a grid reference.
00135      *
00136      * @param[in] x easting of point (meters).
00137      * @param[in] y northing of point (meters).
00138      * @param[in] prec precision relative to 100 km.
00139      * @param[out] gridref National Grid reference.
00140      *
00141      * \e prec specifies the precision of the grid reference string as follows:
00142      * - prec = 0 (min), 100km
00143      * - prec = 1, 10km
00144      * - prec = 2, 1km
00145      * - prec = 3, 100m
00146      * - prec = 4, 10m
00147      * - prec = 5, 1m
00148      * - prec = 6, 0.1m
00149      * - prec = 11 (max), 1um
00150      *
00151      * The easting must be in the range [-1000 km, 1500 km) and the northing
00152      * must be in the range [-500 km, 2000 km).  An exception is thrown if
00153      * either the easting and northing is outside these bounds.  These bounds
00154      * are consistent with rules for the letter designations for the grid
00155      * system.
00156      **********************************************************************/
00157     static void GridReference(real x, real y, int prec, std::string& gridref);
00158 
00159     /**
00160      * Convert OSGB coordinates to a grid reference.
00161      *
00162      * @param[in] gridref National Grid reference.
00163      * @param[out] x easting of point (meters).
00164      * @param[out] y northing of point (meters).
00165      * @param[out] prec precision relative to 100 km.
00166      * @param[in] centerp if true (default), return center of the grid square,
00167      *   else return SW (lower left) corner.
00168      *
00169      * The grid reference must be of the form: two letters_ (not including I)
00170      * followed by an even number of digits_ (up to 22).
00171      **********************************************************************/
00172     static void GridReference(const std::string& gridref,
00173                               real& x, real& y, int& prec,
00174                               bool centerp = true);
00175 
00176     /** \name Inspector functions
00177      **********************************************************************/
00178     ///@{
00179     /**
00180      * @return \e a the equatorial radius of the Airy 1830 ellipsoid (meters).
00181      *
00182      * This is 20923713 ft converted to meters using the rule 1 ft =
00183      * 10^(9.48401603-10) m.  (The Airy 1830 value is returned because the OSGB
00184      * projection is based on this ellipsoid.)
00185      **********************************************************************/
00186     static Math::real MajorRadius() throw()
00187     // result is about 6377563.3960320664406 m
00188     { return real(20923713) * std::pow(real(10), real(0.48401603L) - 1); }
00189 
00190     /**
00191      * @return \e f the inverse flattening of the Airy 1830 ellipsoid.
00192      *
00193      * For the Airy 1830 ellipsoid, \e a = 20923713 ft and \e b = 20853810 ft;
00194      * thus the flattening = (20923713 - 20853810)/20923713 = 7767/2324857 =
00195      * 1/299.32496459...  (The Airy 1830 value is returned because the OSGB
00196      * projection is based on this ellipsoid.)
00197      **********************************************************************/
00198     static Math::real Flattening() throw()
00199     { return  real(20923713 - 20853810) / real(20923713); }
00200 
00201     /**
00202      * <b>DEPRECATED</b>
00203      * @return \e r the inverse flattening of the Airy 1830 ellipsoid.
00204      **********************************************************************/
00205     static Math::real InverseFlattening() throw() { return 1/Flattening(); }
00206 
00207     /**
00208      * @return \e k0 central scale for the OSGB projection (0.9996012717).
00209      **********************************************************************/
00210     static Math::real CentralScale() throw()
00211     { return real(0.9996012717L); }
00212 
00213     /**
00214      * @return latitude of the origin for the OSGB projection (49 degrees).
00215      **********************************************************************/
00216     static Math::real OriginLatitude() throw() { return real(49); }
00217 
00218     /**
00219      * @return longitude of the origin for the OSGB projection (-2 degrees).
00220      **********************************************************************/
00221     static Math::real OriginLongitude() throw() { return real(-2); }
00222 
00223     /**
00224      * @return false northing the OSGB projection (-100000 meters).
00225      **********************************************************************/
00226     static Math::real FalseNorthing() throw() { return real(-100000); }
00227 
00228     /**
00229      * @return false easting the OSGB projection (400000 meters).
00230      **********************************************************************/
00231     static Math::real FalseEasting() throw() { return real(400000); }
00232     ///@}
00233 
00234   };
00235 
00236 } // namespace GeographicLib
